intro: Hypecoum imberbe subsp. pseudograndiflorum, commonly known as the African hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it grows as an annual or biennial herb. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. The flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
